Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Andrei> Hello, can you uptade information for  "Circulating Supply"  ?  Thank you

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Alien> Why doesn't hush havte any volume?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-hush] <Pixelised> CMC needs an API that returns the circulating supply as a number. 

If I was still active as a web developer, I'd do it by coding up a PHP script that would interact with the CLI and run "./hush-cli coinsupply" on the same machine running a hush (komodod) node. 

The result from that command outputs an array and I'd just echo coinsupply_result("total"); to the web browser at say www.pixelised.org/hush_query.php?q=total

Note: This would require a host running a webserver with PHP and Hush node.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Pixelised> Where you can change the "q" variable to any of the other array indexes like "coin", "height", "supply", "zfunds" and "total".

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-hush] <gilardh> @Andrei 
```
Hello, can you uptade information for  "Circulating Supply"  ?  Thank you
```
Where ?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Pixelised> @gilardh  I assume on CMC.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <gilardh> 'Circulating Supply : 5‚ÄØ641‚ÄØ700 HUSH' is false ?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Pixelised> On CMC the circulating supply is 5,641,700.  At height 23523, the total is  6471042.61112515. Doing whole numbers arithmetic, the difference is 829342 Hush coins. Which would add another $55266.52 to the market cap at the current price of $0.066639.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Pixelised> A lot of info was out of date on CMC.

Author: Gateway#3763

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Pixelised> @gilardh, not sure. Will send you DM.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @CHMEX thanks, that is very close to our actual "total supply" ! In theory, we should add about 71,000 locked sprout funds to our total supply, but your number above is much closer than the wrong numbers on CMC/coingecko

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> I am thinking about making a special case in the `coinsupply` RPC for HUSH which adds in those locked sprout funds

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-hush] <CHMEX> this is what I get from coinsupply
{
  "result": "success",
  "coin": "HUSH3",
  "height": 23568,
  "supply": 6467723.05635994,
  "zfunds": 3882.05476521,
  "sprout": 0.00000000,
  "total": 6471605.11112515
}

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @CHMEX yes, I think your insight /supply endpoint uses `gettxoutsetinfo`, which probably has the same `supply` number. `coinsupply` is a kmd-specific RPC and the insight code most likely doesn't use it. I see it lists sprout specifically, huh

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> the thing is, we have a total supply which is spread across 2 blockchains

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> 71K sprout locked into the old chain, and the 6.4M Hush on the new chain

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> it's a complex situation, which most coins are never in, and it makes the ideas of "circulating supply" and "total supply" kind of complex

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> 6.4M is our circulating supply

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> but 6.4M + 71,000 is our total supply

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-hush] <CHMEX> ah I see.
( the insight explorer acttualy does not deliver the coinsupply natively from the daemon it's just an api call that is redirected to a cached page it would be impossile to deliver it so quickly I think.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Agreed, it probably caches the output of `gettxoutsetinfo`, which is a very slow RPC

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> In the past, CMC has manually updated our supply, which was just a manual fix that never auto-updated. CMC supply has always been wrong for Hush, ever since I started working on Hush

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <CHMEX> about the locked sprout funds maybe do the same as with ARRR if somebody can produce the viewing key give him the funds from a refund fund ( if there is any )

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @CHMEX yep, Hush is planning to emulate Pirate, if people want to come forward with sprout funds, they can claim funds on the new chain. We have some funds set aside for that

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <jl777c> if they are locked, not part of supply

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @jl777c total supply and circulating supply are different in my mind. They are similar to provably burned utxos, except they happen to be on a different chain as well

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> does "supply" mean "circulating supply" or "total supply that has ever existed", I guess is the question

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> sometimes, as a mathematician, I think too hard about edge cases

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <jl777c> if it is updating, that is not max, so must be circulating

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> well, that makes life easier

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @heguli97 i updated this issue with the various ways people can get hush supply: https://github.com/MyHush/hush3/issues/16

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <CHMEX> I did not even see that issue:)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-hush] <CHMEX> I also agree that if the coin is issued and can be accessed it's circulating.
for ex. RFOX is a great example the mcap is +-35m and not +-7m ( taking the definition of a big cryptomarketcap website )

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> it's always been "easy" for CMC/coingecko to get Hush supply via our RPCs or insight APIs, but they have never wanted to actually do it. Maybe they are getting more organized now
